intro: Galium trinervium, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Galium trinervium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
